website_summaries.verdict: These higher-quality shinguards are a good pick for taller martial artists.
pros: Dual-padding built with Shell-Shock gel and Supremo-Shock Foam.Lightweight with nylon based Nylastic outer cover
Hook-and-loop closure with dual cross straps
cons: Individuals who are under 5'5" may have trouble finding a size that doesn't block knee movement

customer_reviews.title: Not for individuals shorter than around 5'4"
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'3", and I have purchased and returned these twice. I ordered the medium at first according to the sizing guidelines - way too long (blocked my knee, so it's really uncomfortable to bend my knee). I ordered a small hoping it would fix the issue - pretty much the same length as the medium. There really was no difference in length. It was just tighter. Sizing is terrible for shorter individuals.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Great protection, sometimes slips off to the side
customer_reviews.text: I've been kicked a sufficient amount of times to now effectively post a review on these shin pads. Simply put, they're great. They certainly do the trick protecting your legs. I unfortunately had to give them less than a perfect rating for the key issue that I've come across time and time again while on the mat. While training, the pads will begin to shift away from the middle of my shin. It's not a terrible issue, but in theory, shin pads shouldn't move when someone is kicked in the legs. I do have a thinner frame which could contribute to this, but I would venture to guess that even with thicker shins it may still happen.
customer_reviews.author: 16th

customer_reviews.title: I am returning them.  2 stars for comfort there are issues
customer_reviews.text: First let start by saying I like RDX gloves. I bought these I like the stream line fit. But I have included a picture where the bottom of the shin guard digs into the bottom part of the shin. maybe this will break in after while but its noticeable and uncomfortable. The materials seems durable. I am gonna return when I flex my feet it digs in. I like the material and the look so I am a little disappointed. fairtex or venum will be my next choice.
customer_reviews.author: Love Life Light

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to take on and off, easy to air out.
customer_reviews.text: Big improvement over my previous set. They don’t slide around in training, and don’t retain sweat, Before purchasing these I use to wear pads with neoprene fabric that would fit like sock instead of straps. The design kept it from shifting in practice but would hold in sweat and started to smell after a couple of weeks. I tried different ways of washing them and airing them out, with little to no success.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Ivan Orendain-Necochea

customer_reviews.title: Too bad because I did like them and even though I've ...
customer_reviews.text: This product ripped at the instep elastic and the whole front foot came un-sewn. Too bad because I did like them and even though I've only had them since Oct I am passed the return date.
customer_reviews.author: staci s.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a lot of shin pads during my 38 years in martial arts. These are, by far, the best. The quality is great, the padding is "just right" (not too soft, not to hard) and they fitold comfortably. Every pair will spin on you a bit and you have to adjust them from time to time, but that's just how it goes. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: K. D. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty alright. I'm digging them. They provide good protection, feel comfortable. These are my first pairs of shin guards as I'm a bit new to the whole MMA scene, but I wasn't sure if I got two of the same right leg guards (as in, two shin guards for your right leg). They have a small "r" on each foot and it was throwing me off a little. They do wiggle around a little, throughout practice, but I wonder if that's normal with all shin guards or perhaps it's because I had such chicken calves (working on it). Anyway, I think they're a good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Meda

customer_reviews.title: Great shin protection, but foot pad needs to be more durable
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for two months for Muay Thai sparring and pad kicking (Size L, 6".0 and 180 lbs). The shin protection is great, fits well and stays in place. The foot protector extends all the way over my toes, which is not my preference, I'd like them a little shorter. The foot protection shifts easily and on one of the pads the elastic foot strap is starting to tear already. I can probably use them for a few more months until that strap comes off, so not as durable as I would expect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DZ

customer_reviews.title: Lack of quality control. Bad design.
customer_reviews.text: I am returning these after trying them on once. They are uncomfortable with a stiff piece of leather connecting the foot and the shin pad. You can feel it when you stand up with it. The biggest problem is that the foot pad on the right foot is bigger than the one on the left.
customer_reviews.author: KenGsaur

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I was very new to Muay Thai when I purchased these. They’re are good for the price, I know understand the comments saying these will condition your shins quickly lol. For the amount I use them though they’re perfect. Only issue I noticed is the part that covers the foot is attached to the shin pad with a cheap material. I can see this tearing rather easily depending on your intensity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: foot pads shift around left and right. very annoying
customer_reviews.text: the foot pads shift around left to right and rub against the toes (and it hurst) i got the correct size according to the size chart maybe they are too small. not sure. but lengthwise everything seemed ok.
customer_reviews.author: DSK

customer_reviews.title: Great protection and comfort .
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put them on, they have Velcro straps. I had bought other brand and you have to put them on like tall socks and remove your shoes. this brand you just strap them to your legs, way easier and less hot.
customer_reviews.author: Krangel

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t sit right on your leg. The foot guard and shin guard both broke. The band that goes behind your heel is trash. Lasted a month. Don’t waist your money, get a pair a little more expensive that’ll last.
customer_reviews.author: Aubie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I got these and were extremely happy with the overall comfort at first. However, I was disappointed the first time i had a kick checked with them. It was rather uncomfortable. I used them approximately 8 times for basic kickboxing drills, and 2 times for sparring and the leg strap nearly ripped completely off. My drills and sparring were not excessively rough, at best they were average. Alot of money for something I used less than 2 weeks. I did return them and that was a smooth process.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Rose

customer_reviews.title: Nice but ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice guard but padding isn't especially good. If you're in between sizes, choose larger size. I chose smaller-it works but it isn't ideal. Going up would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hornbeck

customer_reviews.title: Good but only negative is the
customer_reviews.text: Very efficient for long training periods and sparring, along with an amazing feel and enclosure around the leg. Only complaint is the leather strip connecting the pieces that cover the shin and top of the foot, which takes a long time to break in. It is often very uncomfortable and requires readjusting frequently in the first few weeks. Overall, a good product and would recommend to anyone who doesn't mind a little discomfort at first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Alright for a few classes
customer_reviews.text: Will get you through a few classes, but if you go regularly to muay thai, not the best. I'm 5'8" and 195 lb., and I purchased the mediums. For length, these fit well and the width around my thick calves worked as well, but during class, I continously kept needing to readjust them from sliding sideways and sliding down. I also notice stings already started coming out and I've only been to a handfull of classes.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: 3.5 stars, good pads, but pretty stiff and mediocre padding.
customer_reviews.text: The pads are pretty good, but the padding is a little on the light side and they are pretty stiff overall. A good pair of pads, but may cause some bumps and bruises. Very good for starting on conditioning the legs for kicking, which is a big part of training if you are serious.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: They work great. Nice price, nice quality, and their ridgid enough to absorb impact during sparring
customer_reviews.author: unkown

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Have lasted for me so far through hard training. Have been using for about 8 months with no signs of wear
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bottom strapped snapped after using for about 5 weeks. I train in Muay Thai 4 times per week and take care to gear up and strip off my gear carefully. Product is past the refund date according to Amazon policies. Hopefully the seller or manufacturer is willing to refund as I believe I got a defective product. Until then, pass on this shin guard set unless you want to end up in my situation, one working shin guard and $45 wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Arla R. Luithly

customer_reviews.title: Great for light sparring
customer_reviews.text: Not too much padding, not too little either. They are awesome for the price and have double foot straps so they stay put on your legs and feet
customer_reviews.author: Logan W

customer_reviews.title: Padding is rather thin in comparison to TOP KING or ...
customer_reviews.text: Padding is rather thin in comparison to TOP KING or FAIRTEX, but hold up well the impact for me. I m trainning to 2 years twice a week. Im 180cm 88kg, sparring lightly once a week. So its regular/mild use, nothing too extreme. If youre a pro, or close, maybe these are not protection enough for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo de Souza Micelli

customer_reviews.title: No.
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money on better shin guards.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great shin guards perfect for sparring and drilling! don't move on your shins. perfect amount of protection to still protect the shins but also condition them! recommend to any fighter
customer_reviews.author: Jemma Breslin

customer_reviews.title: Only issue is I have large calves, and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Only issue is I have large calves, and I even bought the large ones.. but the straps on the back are fairly uncomfortable nothing you cant get used too.. but the instep goes a bit past my toes lol.. I have around a size 10 foot... so I probably need some combination of a medium and a large.. but it works..
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Great shin guards
customer_reviews.text: These shin guards Couture very well to your leg. The padding isn’t to thick. Works very well in sparring.
customer_reviews.author: kiki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: This are excellent shin pads for Thai Boxing and mma. A lot of value for the money, and the sizing is spot on. Comfortable and the shape keeps them from shifting. Very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Robert storkson

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product for the price. 5'8" 135 skinny legged. The Smalls fit me perfectly height wise. I wish there was a little more adjustment to make them fit a touch tighter.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Both great fit and quality
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a large set for myself (5'11) and medium for my friend 5'2. Both great fit and quality. The size chart is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: M N

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the shin guards for my son. He is very satisfied .
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Super! My MMA coach picked these out for me and I'm very happy. The padding seems high quality, it's not too soft nor too hard... they're great
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Could be longer in the straps
customer_reviews.text: It has four stars because although it is a great product. The fit isn’t there for me. The straps are short for my calf’s.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Manuel Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Product is good, customer service questionable
customer_reviews.text: Shin guards are very good, most comfortable ones I had so far. However the letter you get afterwards from Director or Customer Experience it's too much, it's not like I bought the whole fighting gear, I personally consider it a little bit creepy.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: Straps are short. Great otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: They definitely get the job done and absorb shock, but the straps are waaay too short. I'm a smaller female, but have pretty developed calves from dance. Regardless, the straps should have been made longer because they keep popping open while training.
customer_reviews.author: Gab Crespo

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, nice design and good product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a month now with at least 2-3 hours of use on the daily basis.. they’re holding up strong and the cushion it’s just the right amount. They’re not too bulky , if you follow the fittment chart you shouldn’t have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: jamille acevedo

customer_reviews.title: The best!!
customer_reviews.text: They are accurate if you choose the right size. The quality is second to none, and they are very comfortable. The best!
customer_reviews.author: mfwahrmann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice.
customer_reviews.text: They give you the protection expected. But sometimes it moves to one side (on the foot). They are awesome and always thinking that was a good purchase, never refused.
customer_reviews.author: Nico Duda

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: It exceeded my expectation. The product is as advertised. I'm often skeptical about a products quality. These guards are very good quality. Good Product and the fitment is good. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AARON P MUNCY

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shinguards for Muy Thai. I haven't had any issues with them moving around and I rarely need to adjust them during my 1-hr classes. Huge step up from my previous shinguards.. now I don't go home from class with black & blue shins :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They feel really good super light feels almost if nothing is on your ...
customer_reviews.text: They feel really good super light feels almost if nothing is on your legs. No restrictions but my complaints are the stitching is coming apart after a couple of months and I’m not a constant sparring partner with my job. And they tend to slide down constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for someone looking for thiner shin guards
customer_reviews.text: These are good shin guards, especially for the money. They may be a bit thin for some. You definitely get some bone on bone contact if you are sparring with some purpose, but they really do well at taking the edge off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I used it few times and compared to what my ...
customer_reviews.text: THANK YOU RDX I ordered RDX shin guard and gloves and I had a comment on the shin guard and a delay with the gloves but RDX showed great response offering me a higher model shin guard and the gloves free of charge. I really appreciate your support Thnx
customer_reviews.author: walotaibi

customer_reviews.title: Fits really well and its comfortable for a long session of sparring
customer_reviews.text: Is a great product overall. It fit me really well and its easy to put on and take off, making it easier when I'm putting the gear for a session of sparring. It has enough cushion to not hurt the teammates or yourself. Great product overall and great prices.
customer_reviews.author: Jun

customer_reviews.title: shin guards that fit
customer_reviews.text: These shin guards are great .They are a good fit very comfortable I would from this Company again thank you .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved them!
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’3 118 lbs and I brought the small and these fit perfect for Muay Thai. They do shift but not as much as others I’ve brought. They are super protective and I also love the way they look. I would definitely recommend these to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product and A+++ customer service
customer_reviews.text: I am blown away by the customer service ! These are also very high quality shin guards . I'm 6'2 , 168 lbs. The XL fit perfect . I will be making more purchases with this company !
customer_reviews.author: jeremy lucas

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for the price. These are plenty sturdy and look like they will hold up. Only time will tell, but they are starting out well. I'm 6', 190lbs and I got the XL, and they fit great. I think the L might have been snug.
customer_reviews.author: J. Soriano

customer_reviews.title: Also me Fit
customer_reviews.text: Nice new shin guards, I had the last generation of them. The news fit even better,
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. I use them for Muay Thai training. They don’t move much at all but I have large legs so that may help. They are super comfortable and don’t stink like my last pair of leg guards.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Martinez

customer_reviews.title: They have a sizing chart so you get the right size for you
customer_reviews.text: The speed of delivery upon order was awesome. I am using them for mixed martial arts. They had a diagram on page to help make my order correct to my size. I don’t know about durability yet as I have only used them for a short time.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Shin Guards
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shin guards... small and form fitting but very good for MMA training. Flexible fit and covers all points of the leg, durable leather. Covers the entire foot as well.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Fajardo

customer_reviews.title: Best Shin Guards for Muay Thai
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase. Shin guards fit perfectly and are not too big or move around when you spar like other brands I’ve tried before. They look great and give excellent protection. Totally recomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHIN GUARDS
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got no complaints on these shin guards, I would highly recommend buying them. very comfortable. Only thing that would make these better would be white and gold
customer_reviews.author: Loxbey Montalvan

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and fit. great value for money. The position of the pad shifts slight so often which is inconvenient at times. Other than that, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Nestor

customer_reviews.title: Shin guards
customer_reviews.text: awesome quality shin pads great straps not too thick nor too thin of a shin pad perfect for mma sparring
customer_reviews.author: Danny Cedano

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately couldnt use them
customer_reviews.text: Well I really liked these a lot but the first day I tried to use them I could not because the buckles on the back cut into my leg really bad. I had to send them back but I am looking forward to trying a different RDX type
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: But I still gonna rate this a five because it's actually pretty good. Good protection
customer_reviews.text: First I must say that I got the biggest size and it didn't fit.... But I still gonna rate this a five because it's actually pretty good. Good protection, cool look and easy to put on. Needs stronger stitching though.
customer_reviews.author: John Shadows

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: These have worked great so far. Fit snug and not a lot of slippage.

customer_reviews.title: Great for ladies with big calf muscles
customer_reviews.text: I tried the several, yet had problems due to my big calf muscles. However, these fit and are comfortable.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I like the straps these Carry In the past my other shin guards always move and get out of place while training these fit great stay in place and never have to adjust them !

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably light
customer_reviews.text: Probably the lightest pads in this fashion. I was odd man out sparring today and was thinking the tops remind me of a gladiators shin pads when going in to battle

customer_reviews.title: Small straps but still works.

customer_reviews.title: Shine to the face
customer_reviews.text: Great light weight yet durable The extra strap that goes around your Achilles isn’t the best but other than that these shinguards are perfect

customer_reviews.title: Fit great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son and he loves them. Like most shin guards, they need to be adjusted every once in a while due to kicks but that is to be expected. They look great and my son says they are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Teran

customer_reviews.title: Great protection and they stay in place
customer_reviews.text: Great protection and they stay in place. I'd give 5 stars but these babys get you hot because they don't breathe.

customer_reviews.title: Just buy a bigger size when ordering
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an X-Large and still is small for me.. Im a 215 Pounds male.. Just buy a bigger size when ordering

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality.
customer_reviews.text: They broke after a week of use. Barely use them a couple times before they went broken. Tried to return them but it was too late. Wouldn’t buy this brand again.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Pads
customer_reviews.text: Nice, but they rotate on your shins and feet when really kicking the bag hard. The shifting is increased when you product sweat too.

customer_reviews.title: They work fantastic and keep his shins from being cut up or ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the skin guards for my husband who actually wears them over his pants at work. They work fantastic and keep his shins from being cut up or bruised.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Good product, will definitely last a long time and they're extremely comfortable which was a selling point for me.

product_meta.title: RDX Shin Guards for Boxing Training & MMA Fighting Approved by SMMAF Maya Hide Leather Muay Thai Instep Leg Protective Gear | Great Protector Pads for Martial Arts, Sparring, Kickboxing, BJJ, Karate
feature_bullets: RDX Shin insteps are manufactured with lightweight Maya Hide Leather and Nylon inner fabric for integrated durability. The resilient material resists wear and tear for a prolonged amount of time without losing its original shape. Perfectly assists you in Muay Thai, Kick boxing, MMA, BJJ, Karate and more.(CE Certified Approved)(Approved By (SMMAF) Swedish Mixed Martial Arts Federation)
These shin instep guards are enormously solid and Shell-Shock gel delivers eventual impact resistance. The shell shock gel protection is exclusively manufactured for real tough training sessions.

Supremo Shock foam deliver prime level of cushioning. This allows the guards to distribute the heavy pressure out and around the surface area. Further, suppressing foam significantly reduces the chance of injuries while absorbing shock.
RDX shin instep guards are contrived with the distinctive QD-1 sweat wicking properties that exceeds ventilation expectations and keeps your shin dry and free of bad odors.

Quick-EZ hook-and-loop strap promises a protected and adjustable fit reducing chances of shin instep guards slipping off during competition or sparring. Unique EZ strap provides compact grip while stabilizing it solidly and allowing the optimum amount of leg flexion without restricting any movement.
